sourceMeaningMnemonic: An <radical>alligator</radical> is <kanji>considerably</kanji> dangerous. Considerably terrifying too. Considerably [put your scary adjective here].
meaningInfo: The radical meaning and the kanji meaning aren't the same, but we'll get through this together. Just put a considerable amount of effort into this and you'll learn considerably more quickly.
readingMnemonic: Speaking of <kanji>considerably</kanji> terrifying, that place known as <reading>Nar</reading>nia (<ja>なり</ja>) is pretty terrifying. Not sure why children want to go there.
readingInfo: Also, things that are "considerably" anything start somewhere. They <reading>become</reading> (<ja>なり</ja>) whatever "considerable" thing they are now from something smaller before.
